result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey B. Pozdol was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey B. Pozdol is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey B. Pozdol was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Jeffrey B. Pozdol was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day served if revoked.  Defendant may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Pay DNA surcharge  $250.00.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,150.00 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with Richard Stryjewski.

Conditions of Probation

Appearances:  ADA Anderson; Atty Kmiec w/DE.  Deft pleads guilty to cts. 1 & 2.  Cts. 3,4,5 are dismissed.  Court finds deft guilty.  Parties waive PSI.  Argument heard on sentencing.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on 18 mos. probation w/conditions.  Credit for 1 day, if revoked.  Court will consider expunction if/when probation successfully completed.
Appearances:  ADA Anderson; Atty Kmiec w/DE.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT set over to 7/7/14 at 2:30.

Appearances:  ADA Anderson; Atty Kmiec w/DE.  For reasons set forth on the record, parties agree to schedule DA PTC for 4/25/14 at 1:30 and FPT for 5/14/14 at 9:00.

and Procedures

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Ted Kmiec. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Wagner filed by Atty. Kmiec and by co-def. Tab pulled for Judge Warren. Subject to the approval of Judge Wagner, cases are bound over to Br. 5. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-16-14 @ 8:30am with co-def. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Ted Kmiec. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Co-def.'s attorney was unavailable for hearing. Atty. Kmiec agrees to waive time limits and adjourn today to reschedule preliminary hearing with co-def.'s case. Time limits tolled. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 3-6-14 @ 9:00am with co-def. Bond continued.
